Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Fruity grape aroma, citrus, tangerines, lemon zest, pine apples and peach. Hoppy citrus and pine flavor, tangerines, caramel, lemon zest, some peach. Fresh hoppy beer, very good but maybe I was expecting more.
Hazy golden. Tropical, citric and herbal. White bread. Soft and juicy. Medium bitter, light sweet to dry. Light acidic. Medium bodied. Just perfect.

Can 16fl.oz. @ home. [ As Tree House Julius ].[ Courtesy of Glen ]. Unclear - hazy medium orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grass, dusty fruit, mandarin, peach, orange - citrus. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, mandarin, orange, fruity, hoppy, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160302]

Can, four weeks old, by way of trade with Rich182. Cheers Rich! Cloudy gold. Film of sticky, off white head. Nose is big, fresh, juicy hop. Ripe orange. Peach. Mango. The full works. Notes of pine resin. Juicy and dank. Lovely aroma. Taste is resinous bitter. Lots of citrus pith. Some grainy sweetness. Juicy, smooth, hop oily mouthfeel. Fine carbonation. Long, pithy bitter finish. Silly easy drinking. Lovely.

Can. Thanks AntonFred! Hazy orange liquid with small to medium off-white head. Aroma of fresh hops, weed, tangerine, lemon peel, citrus, mango, pineapple and rose buds. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of pineapple, fresh hops, citrus and fresh hops. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Awesome. So hoppy.

Can a week old. Nose is starts off dank becoming more juicy fruits as it warms, some minerality. Taste is dry but juicy hops, fairly bitter grapefruit, with flavors of mango and limestone. Not my favorite Tree House though despite its role as the flag bearer.

Multiple times from can and growler.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: very hoppy, fruity, balanced, passionfruit.
TASTE: very fruity, bit high in carbo, nice bitter aftertaste.

Can

Piny, grape peel and tropical fruits on the back note of the aroma. 

Very fruity upon impact, with such a smooth finish that it literally feels like it disappears in your mouth. 
Slight notes of raspberries with a slight (!) bitternes after a while. 
So smooth!

Growler thanks to Leighton late night at HamTech reunion, such a blast! Pours hazy gold, white head. Aroma is bursting with citrus, tropical fruits, melon, dank resin. Flavor is med sweet, gooey fruit bomb.. melon/citrus. Killer stuff.

Can at home. Cloudy amber with a small off white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, mango, light onion and orange. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Light medium bodied with a juicy hop coating palate and soft carbonation. Great stuff.

Boundary-pushing and pretty unbelievable, this beer definitely challenges what an IPA can be. Theres an insane amount of sticky, juicy hop aroma and flavor packed into the can, and the not-so-subtle reference to orange juice is pretty spot-on -- it smells and tastes like oranges. Its somewhere between hazy and cloudy, theres only the smallest amount of bitterness, and the mouthfeel is pretty creamy and smooth. My only objection is that after one or two of those the lack of bitterness can make it taste pretty sweet. Still, its incredible and iconic.

Close to perfect IPA. Pours a very cloudy orange/light brown, like chicken stock. Very strong aromatic tropical/herbal aroma, explodes with tropical fruit juice (pineapple/mango most prominent) on the palate, continues citrusy/earthy with a clean bitter finish. Just outstanding.

Can dated 12/9/15. Kinda murky pale pour. Off-white head. Juicy citrus nose. Finishes with some urine. Still plenty of freshness even at 2 months. Moderately sweet, moderately bitter finish. Oily textur. Medium body. Yummy.

[1/30/16] Can sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Cloudy orange. Fruity oniony hops aroma. Dry flavor with "green" fruity hops. Medium-bodied.

Can. Pours cloudy orangish. Aroma is Citrus (Orange, Grapefruit and tangerine). Taste is orange, grapefruit and tangerine with pine grapefruit finish. It was totally worth the trouble getting a can here in CO.

16 oz can poured a hazy gold with a small lingering ivory head. Aromas of bread, dank bud, grapefruit, light lemon zest and light earthiness. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of bread, lemon zest, grapefruit zest, dankness and light earthiness with a smooth dry bitter lingering dank citrus finish.
A good but not boundary pushing IPA. I like but dont love what it is in todays IPA scene. Fruit is strong on the nose and but didnt translate to the taste.

Pours a hazy golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of oranges, grapefruit and other tropical fruit. Taste follows, bitter and citrusy. Dont get me wrong this is tasty but it doesnt live up to the hype in my opinion.

Where: gift from Maxbier, thanks!  
How: 16 ounce can.
Appearance: Cloudy orange body with a decent white head. 
Aroma: Citrus, and more citrus.
Taste: Tropical and citrus flavors, orange, mango, guava, hops and some heat. 
Palate: medium and medium. 
Overall: Pretty excellent beer, no complaints at all. Drink it.

16 oz can shared with ebone1988. Got this gem from Eddie, a god damned hero of Tree House. The pour is a foggy golden orange color. Hazy as fuck with no clarity. There is a thinner white head with a lot of soapy lace they just looks magical. The aroma is great. There is a juicy hop that I love that brings about a heavy hop bitterness. I love how the back end smells like a hefty orange juice. This is going to be outstanding. The flavor is great. Huge orange fruit juice all throughout. There is a beautiful hoppiness. It's bright and bitter with a great hop and lingering orange juice. The mouth feel is spot on. It's just thin enough with an excellent quick carbonation and a lingeringly dank orange juice flavor. This amazing. I need to find King Julius now 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 Can shared with koleminer20. Holy shit. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus, juicy, pine, slight dank, floral, amazing. Appearance is amber golden, white head, hazy. Taste is crazy citrus, pine, dank, dry, perfect. Mouthfeel is crisp carbonation and light body, tons of bitter hop aftertaste. Overall, my god. This is unbelievable.
Honestly the most drinkable beer I have ever had. Slight fruit taste. Just enough ABV. My favorite beer to date.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 Can, much thanks to Chris. Pours out a cloudy, vodka heavy screwdriver color with a small white head. Aroma is intense, super fruity and juicy. Tropical fruits, tangerine, mango, passion fruit, some perfume, and some sweet notes. Taste is sooo juicy, mango, tangerine, sweet Florida orange, passion fruit, some perfumy notes, light sugary sweetness in the finish. Incredible how they made this, this juicy. Damn these things look ugly in a glass, but man do they taste good, too easy to crush this stuff.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2016 At home. 0,5L can shared by my dealer Maakun. Cloudy orange/ochre with white head. Very hoppy nose. Tropical fruit party, passionfruit, mango, oranges, lemon, skunk, weed, mary jane. Taste mild sweet and mild bitter, just the flavor of planty, weedy hops, no extreme bitterness, which is great. Body is medium to full with hop residue graininess and medium carbonation. Amazing fruitiness and good taste balance. Im burping marijuana flavored burps! I love this!

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2016 Can shared massive thanks to Secret Santa bytemesis. Murky dark orange golden with big cream colored head. Mango, lemon, orange, pineapple, passion fruit, just lots of fruity hops up front. Light mariuana and dried grass. Underneath some bread and biscuits, balanced nicely with the hops. Also a very light mineral touch. Under medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied with creamy carbonation. Wow, really love this, great stuff.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 can. first thing you notice is the aroma while pouring this is amazing! You can tell how fresh it is. the taste is delicious, extremely smooth. Not as hoppy as some of my favorites, but everything else about this is phenomenal! I feel like I could drink like 20 of these in one night. so smooth and delicious

Can shared with Alex, jf and Seb A: citrusy, piny, tropical app: hazy pale small white head t/p: med body with moderate long bitter finish. Soft to moderate carbonation. O: pretty good. Fruity like I like.

16 oz. can. Thanks Michael! It pours a very hazy/cloudy light orange color with a small but lasting off white head. The aroma is full with sweet grapefruit, pineapple, papaya, mango and hints of melon. Sweet tropical fruit, although not as potent as I expected. The flavor has a solid bready pale malt backbone, bordering on doughy with more big tropical fruits. Mango, pineapple and papaya. Not much else. Maybe a hint of spice near the finish with restrained bitterness. Mild astringency and grassiness. The full, pale bready maltiness makes me feel like this has mostly English base malt with that low flocculating yeast strain that leaves things a bit muddled. Definitely tasty stuff, but didnt quite live up to the hype for me.

[ growler ][ 1oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ ? ][ snifter ][ 12.06.15 ]murky orange-amber, thin frothy small bubbled white IPAed. Root heavy, earthy profile, softly resinous pine balanced with some caramel, low malt. Profile equally muted, softly earthly with light moss, orange rind, resin growing through mid. Sticky finish, lightly papery. Its balanced, but the lack of depth and nuance is clear. Literally, this isnt even novel?!

Beautiful floral bready hoppiness to the aromas. Beautiful cloudy Orange with lasting head. A beautiful hop that is there and then so ballanced that an ipa hater still will love it. Lives up to any claim.

Nov 2015 - Can share at Leightons 15K, many thanks to Mr 15K himself. Hazy orange, cloudy, small foamy off-white head. Aroma is dried fruit, oniony dank, mint and spice. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is pine, honeydew melon, onion, watermelon, tangy fruits. Almost tastes like it has had fruit added. A very good IPA.
Pour from a growler shared by Armin, thanks! Super cloudy, nice head. Big citrus and tropical fruit nose. Well balanced with massive floral hops. Excellent.

Poured from a can dated Dec. 02, 2015. 
Aroma is very hop forward with lots of mango and passion fruit. Some moderate orange and other citrus notes, similar to Sunny D. Some light dank and resin notes. Faint cracker malt notes in the background. Very juicy. 
Pours a fairly cloudy and murky, dull orange color with a medium sized, moderateky thick, white head. Medium lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with a cracker note that lingers into the finish. Moderate bitterness with a lot of hop character. Passion fruit, mango, orange, tangerine and other tropical fruit and citrus are all present. Some light pine and resin notes. Dry finish. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice juicy, hop forward beer. Good bitterness, but not so much that it gets in the way of the hop flavors. I like that a bit of the malt carries through in the flavor.

Lil Tuesday Tasting in Odense. Muddy golden with a lasting white head. Citrus hoppy aroma with lots of orange peel. Sweet juicy hop flavour with lots of sweet tangerine, and  a somewhat unpleasant green-leaves hop character. Light bitter finish

Brew served up in a gosh dang cane. Pours like OJ both orange and cloudy with a small white head. This has similar qualities to its big brother but its a touch more muted. Its a touch more on the pot aroma. Mango, zesty lemon. The body on this is wonderful. The bitterness is in check and balanced by just a touch of sweetness. Much easier to drink.

750ml growler, less than 1 week old, pours a murky orange with some clumpy, white head. Nose is orange juice, theres a clear malt/bread crumb thing, resinous, soapy. Flavor is juicy, orange, pine, soap, herbs. Full bodied, juicy finish. Solid, but far from transcendent.

Can 473ml.
Pours hazy orange with huge creamy beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, lemon, fruits, vegetal, aloes verra, menthol, pot. Taste is of citrus, bitterness, lemon, malts, clementine, herbs, slight vegetal notes, pot. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Oustanding, very nice hops.

Growler at the DC Mini Tasting, thanks solidfunk! Hazy golden amber/orange with off-white head. Aromas of big orange and grapefruit citrus, floral. Tastes of tropical, orange and grapefruit, floral, pine, garlic and onion. Medium body with a dry finish.
Bottle courtesy of solidfunk, many thanks! Cloudy golden orange color, white head. Nice aroma of tropical fruit and citrus. Taste is juicy bittersweet fruit. Very tasty.
From a bottle shared at the DC mini tasting in December 2015. Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Juicy citrus nose. Flavors of grass and orange. Bitter finish.

Can courtesy of Dfroms - trade in Brussels.
Couleur orangée type abricot, col épais et très persistant, crémeux blanc-cassé.
Arôme est énorme niveau houblons, plein d agrumes avec en retrait un léger fruit de la passion qui ressort en rétro. Note aussi une note orangée.
Palais est assez sec, houblonné, note tropicale de mangue, feuillu et herbacé avec une petite note de pin, fruité dananas, mandarine, pêche. Fini est amer et légèrement râpeux.
This easy drinking citrusy IPA is probably the best on the market. Even if the aroma has faded, this beer has such a smooth and enjoyable body that continues to bring the tropical flavor throughout.

Week old can from source. Very cloudy golden with off white head. Slightly dank citrus hop aroma. Juicy orange sweetness with citrus grapefruit hop with hint of pine. Finish is more orange citrus. Very nice.

Just a mind blowing aroma. Really great tropical fruit notes. Quick fruit and hop flavors up front. Sweet and then slightly tart. Bitter ending is almost dry and floral. Brilliant and drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

There have beers that jumped out at me and were truly memorable. Rochefort 8. Trillium DDH Summer St. Sip of Sunshine. CBS. This is one of them. As soon as you pour, citrusy and melon aromas hit your nose. No need to put the glass near your nose. It finds you. Hazy orange in color. The taste amplifies those aromas. Citrus and smooth. Truly memorable. Cheers!

Can, got to like the can

Hazy orange color, unfiltered as all get out. Bright white head, good staying power and good lacing. 
Nose is deep orange. Mandarin, blood orange, apricot nose. Full on orange attack with hints of some citrus. 
Taste is citrus and lots of orange. Almost an orange cream pop. Very smooth but not overly aggressive. Quite nice though. Very subtle.

Can. Pours muddy orange with a white head. Aroma of hops, orange, tropical, pineapple, very fresh. Taste is rather bitter, tropical, grape, light pine, light passion, smooth. Quite bitter finish. Nice

Can @ Rekvium, Orla and Dolles dødsyge søndagssmagning, 2015. Pours muddy orange with a creamy head. Orange, tangerine, pineapple, mild yeast and bread. Juicy, dry and bitter. Lovely. Thanks for sharing guys!

From can. Pours muddy dark golden with a white head. Aroma of tangerine, citrus, tropical, lots of oranges. Taste is tangerine and tropical, citrus, full mouthfeel, very well balanced. Much better than Green, imo.
Lots of grapefruit and some peel. Light mango, some tangerine. Light sweet finish with light bitterness. Hint of hay. Great balance. Growler after 3 hour wait at brewery.

750 mL growler. Originally reviewed 11/3/2014.
Very hazy orange body. Big white head with nice lacing and a chunky collar.

Smells of orange hops. Metallic sort of aroma. Some toasty malt.

Tastes much better. Tropical fruits. Orange. Lightly toasty cracker malt. A bit of sweetness backs it up. 

Medium body. Kinda creamy. Medium carbonation.

This is good, but I dont get the crazy high ratings it has. I could definitely drink lots of this and would be happy drinking it all the time, but not sure its top 50 caliber.

Can (1 pint) at home. Split 2-ways with the lady. Massive thanks to JulienHuxley for this one! Hazy glowing orangey ala Hill Farmstead with a medium white head leaving pretty good lacing. Nose is super juicy citrus (oranges!) and mangoes along tropical fruits, mild spiciness, dank hops, herbal notes and leafy hops. Taste is also dominated by bold juicy citrus along a good yet subtle malt backbone, onions, leafy notes and moderate bitterness. Body is medium. Carbonation is medium. Like stated in the deScription, the mouthfeel is super pillowy. Herbal finsh. Juicy while also dry. Amazing IPA. A tiny bit better than Alter Ego I had yesterday, which means its pretty awesome. Really easy drinking. Loved it!
16oz can pours a hazy bright yellow color with a lot of frothy head. Herbaceous and stone fruit in the hops.

Fresh can poured into glass, strong citrus aroma, orange and apricot. Pours a very hazy orange color, with fluffy off white head. Taste is very tropical and juicy, orange and mango so slightly sweet, but works well with nice hoppy finish, one not overpowering the other. Not piney or resiny at all. Feel is juicy and creamy like the name suggests. Overall - great IPA, but a different twist to the more traditional ones.

Poured an extremely hazy orange with a white head. Aroma was melony, resinous. Flavor was a punch in the mouth of almost medicinal melon character, low bitterness, but flavor almost makes the mouth pucker. Certainly different, not sure how much I like it.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Lotta hype surrounding this one. Can in a trade. Pours a hazy orangey yellow with a white head. Aromas are of peach, mango and papaya and cantaloupe but the aromas are on the light side compared to the flavor. Holy juice bomb! Tasted like melon and papaya juice. The flavors they get out of the hops are just nuts. Dare I say its too much? By the end of the 8oz I had, my palate had had enough of the crazy melon flavor and wanted to be cleaned up. Still amazing and worth a try. Very different.

Can split at LKS 15K Tasting, big thanks to LKS, 02/11/15.
Hazed orange amber with a decent off white covering that retains well.
Nose is dank hop strokes, bitter orange, toasted malt, skunky notes, grapefruit.
Taste comprises tangerine, pine needle, juicy hops, skunky vibes, grapefruit, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with earthy hop bitterness.
Solid IPA - top end for style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Thx to PriorL & Mathieu87. Can sampled @ "De grote Black Tuesday  Tasting".They recently purchased this one @ the brewery so this one should be FRESH. Very hazy golden, white head only on the side, smallest head of the four we tried (Alter Ego/ Julius/ Haze & this one). Nose is thick yeast (same as the others) with some peach, orange & onion hops, dank. Most bitter one, big yeast dominates with some orange, peach, onion, orange. Yeast smoothie body. A very fashionable modern style USA IPA, slightly reminiscent of what Trillium makes. My least favorite from the four we tried (Alter Ego/ Julius/ Haze & this one). A bit too simple, yeast-heavy as the others but still a very nice beer & fun to drink.

Small white rim, fully hazy orange-ochre beer. Orange, citruspeel, bit of ureum, valerian. Human sweat, preserved orange, bit of passionfruit. Finish is a bit empty, watery. Yeast-filled, light slickness, well carbonated. Bit easy.  Txs to the Vermeersch bros!

Pint can into glass, from Chuck who I met that at Moes, canned today, awesome. Pours a hazy orange peach. Nice head and lacing. Aroma of pleasant orange fields, then pleasant hops, and more fresh citrus. Taste of the same, super fresh, nice and flowing. Orange waves are fulfilling before and after, intensely. Can says 6.8, nice. This is just top notch. Drinkable to an ease, a wonderfully crafted beer. Wow.

Bottle shared at the #LKS15k tasting at craft beer co. Huge thanks to Leighton for this one. Hazed golden orange coloured pour with a sticky white head. Aroma is big juicy juicy fruit, pithy, dank, chive. Plastic, flavour is composed of light grains, orange and lemon rind, dank hop, onion, platic . lingering peach. Palate is highish carbonation, refreshing. Good hoppy stuff.

2nd November 2015Craft Clerkenwell. LKS 15K bash. Can thanks to Leighton. Very hazy gold - orange beer, small pale cream colour head. Thin malt cream. Good skunky start to the hops. Minty pine. Mild hop spice and light citrus. Smooth semi dry finish. Very tasty.

16oz can. Hazed darker golden color with creamy white head. Sweaty, tropical, catty hope on the nose. Very balanced. Good carb, slightly chewy mouthfeel. Resinous, tropical, balanced, bittering finish.

Huge tropical fruit nose white sugar soft malt. Great looking hazy orange yellow juicy looking head lace solid. Awesome fruity balanced Flavors. Tropical juicy soft malt. Really works with the fruity hops. Drinkable. Great beer.
Yep. Orange Julius. You got it. Big orange aroma wafting. Flavor is super citrus orang. Orange peel. A little sweet. Juicy and fruity and tasty. Finish is metallic finish.

475 ml can at home from trade with bytemesis. Thank you Mike! Hazy golden orange color with nice off white head. Aroma is heavy hoppy and light malty, citrusy fruity, orange, mandarin, grapefruit, tropical fruits, passionfruit, pine, grassy, light weedy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.

473ml can from trade. Thanks Don. Aroma: awesome citrus, passion fruits, grapefruits. App: really hazy orange, murky orange, nice lacing almost as if its orange pulp. Taste and palate: medium body, smooth, fluffy, fruity and medium bitter finish. Overall: wow! This is great! Feels like I could replace my morning juice with that! We can almost feel the pulp of the citrus since it tastes so fresh. It?s so soft for the palate. My my. Im in love!

Can thanks to Andy in Boston. It pours super cloudy bright orange with a thick white head. The nose is crazy juicy, mango, orange, tangerine, passion, some dankness and orange orange chewits. The taste is crisp, bitter-sweet, rather soft, juicy, orange peel, tangerine, dried mango, pithy grapefruit, light peppery spice and light grassy dankness with a smooth finish. Medium body and soft, foamy carbonation. Aroma is brilliant. Very well-rounded and highly drinkable. Another winner from Tree House.

Can from brewery. Cloudy orange pour, almost as thick as orange juice, with a thin off white head. Aroma of mangoes, oranges and some candied sugar. medium body with a dangerously smooth snappy finish with little alcohol present. Outstanding.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2015 Can from the brewery, at the moment the only outlet as they cant get ahead of the demand. Poured into a tall tulip producing a nice head. Surprisingly murky and opaque orange look to this beer and an overwhelming citrus aroma. Full bodied with a tasty mouth feel, loaded with citrus flavor, malty richness and a mild hoppy bitterness. Actually, this is my first experience of a fresh hopped ale, and is it fresh! Ive never said this before, but I believe this is a world class brew. Outstanding. Well worth standing in line for.
Reminiscent of a favorite (Fresh Squeezed). Very similar fruity tropical hop profile without being very bitter. Refreshing and delicious!

Tasted on 9/19/15 from a can, big thanks to Drews for sharing. Pours clear, bright orange with a thick white head that leaves rocky lace. The nose is dominated by orange peel and ripe, tropical mango, with some bread malt underlying. The flavor is a more bitter orange peel with the tropical fruit underlying, and some nice bitterness. The body is medium with average carbonation and a long bitter orange peel and touch of ripe mango finish.

fresh can recieved in a trade shared with a friend. poured a deep hazy orange colour with a white head. looks like a deep orange juice. aroma is just insane. nose is hit with a huge amount of tripical fruits, orange, mango flesh, pineapple, melons, and a hint of freshly pressed citrus in the back. the fruitiness is just insane. such an incredible juicy mouthfeel. wich is just indescribable. so full flavored. such a thick full bodied mouthfeel. hands down the best ipa that ive had. incredible stuff!

Lors de mon plus récent périple à Boston, javais comme objectif de mettre le grappin sur une bière de Tree House, mais malheureusement, la brasserie était fermée lors de mon passage. Étant aussi rare quon bon gag de Rachid Badouri, jétais à court de solutions pour en dénicher. Je me suis finalement tourné vers le forum déchanges de Ratebeer et je suis tombé sur un bon samaritain qui est allé men chercher contre quelques DIPA de LTM. Thanks FooFaa!
Alors la Julius, une IPA au visuel marécageux surmontée dun nuage de mousse tenace dont la dentelle lascive adhère aux parois du verre, est considérée comme une des meilleures au monde dans le style.
Dès louverture de la canette, un déchaînement houblonné perfore les voies nasales dune bonne rasade de fruits tropicaux, de mangue, de pêche et dorange sanguine. Un véritable jus de fruits, tout simplement.
Cette sensation juteuse est décuplée en bouche par une texture collante et moelleuse. Toujours aucun support dune céréale quelconque ou presque. Je goûte du melon deau. Du melon au miel même. De lananas. Une parade de fruits divers se promènent sur mon palais. Cest incroyable, jen perds mes mots.
La meilleure IPA bue dans ma vie? Jai envie de dire oui.

New England style IPA fruit bomb. Pours a completely opaque beautiful orange color like a fruit juice. Pillowy head. The nose is unbelievable fruit oranges, mangos, tropical. Mouth feel is somewhat creamy and wonderful. Taste follows the nose then a mid mouth bitterness and a sweet fruit aftertaste. No alcohol on the nose or taste.

Can les than two weeks old from the brewery. Pours hazy bright gold with full lasting dense soapy head. Aroma is pure fresh off the vine hops, Classic american. Flavor is so well rounded between orange juice and light pithy super clean bitter. No sharp edges. The feel is velvety and alive finishing with a light astringency. Theres no complexity. Just perfection.
16 ounce can. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, and malt. Taste is grapefruit, orange, mango, malt, and some pine. Delicious+.

Hazy, opaque orange with a nice and frothy head. Its a beautiful looking beer, but I could see how some could be turned off by its cloudiness (and it probably wouldnt do so well in most style-based competitions). Citrusy and doughy nose. Creamy texture with a gentle amount of carbonation. Very rich hop flavors filled with citrus (tangerine, lemon and grapefruit), rind, resin and pith. Malt side is cakey, bready, earthy and yeasty. Bitterness level is really nice. Juicy citrus flavors linger wonderfully into the aftertaste. Way different from most West Coast IPAs, but I like it, and I would definitely drink it often if it were available in the PNW.
Can shared by my friend Bruce. Pours golden with a thick off-white head and a tropical fruit aroma. There is a medium-bodied pale malt flavor with a grapefruit finish. Well-balance and very tasty.
Can shared by Bruce. Pours golden orange with white head. Taste of citrus and biscuits.
16oz can pours a cloudy orange with a white head. very juicy orange hop taste

16oz can and growler both poured a hazy orange with a small white head. Heavy aromatics of hops with citrus aromas of mango and passion-fruit. Medium bodied, lightly carbonated and does even more damage than the 6.8%abv would suggest. Acquired taste as its heavily bitter, but like heady topper is a well liked and sought after IPA. This has more fruity flavors like the mango and passion-fruit but is mostly quite bitter with a dry finish. Worth the hype if you like the style I suppose, enjoyed.

16 oz can, shared with Borresteijn and JulienHuxley. Hazy dark golden color. Sticky off white head with short retention. Aromas: Dank hops, resin, citrus, mandarin, all really boasting out of the glass. Retronasal its citrus, moderate bitter, leaves/wet hops/tea. flavor is moderate to full bitter, citrus, light malty sweetness. Medium bodied. Long lasting bitterness in the finish. Lovely!

Sample at the Northeastern Brewery (ME/MA) Tasting on 08/09/2015. The beer is a cloudy orange color with a medium thick white head that diminishes gradually. Strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of oranges, herbal hops and malt. Medium body with flavors of clementines, tropical fruit, dank hops and malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a lingering citrusy hops aftertaste. Really good IPA overall.

Pint can from trade with BDuke, thanks man! It pours a hazy ad hell light apricot color with a medium slightly off-white head. Aroma is crazy juicy danky hops, with notes of peaches mango apricots pine cones weed. Taste is juicy fruity grassy piney with mild bitterness in the finish. More notes of ripe peaches, toasted apricots, mango pine cones and skunky weed. Medium bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, incredibly juicy hoppy yet balanced, excellent

50cl Can, thanks Potje! Murky golden orange colour, white head. Aroma of sweet fruity hops, grapefruit, dank stuff, light crisp malts. Flavour is medium sweet, light malty, orange, grapefruit, green tea, leafy, hoppy bitter finish. Light bodied. Nice.

Can shared by Potjebier. Hazy amber gold pour,huge lacy white head. Aroma is super pungent, very hoppy, dank, light citrusy notes, oniony garlicky. Taste is super leafy, oniony, intense juicy hop. Palate is med bodied, silky, good carbonation. Very tasty, amazing.
Can - Grapefruit, mango and some funk. Hazy gold with a decent white head. Fruity, tropical and a bit of bitterness. Nice.

500mL can, pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out notes of oranges, citrus hops and skunky herbal notes. Flavour reveals notes of fresh orange and citrus hops, some grapefuit, floral horas and a dry biscuity malt backbone. Dry, fruity and citric. Excellent stuff.
Can thanks to Steve. Pours a cloudy orange with medium frothy white head. The aroma is strong citrus, mango and grapefruit. Medium mouth, grapefruit, nice light bitterness, juicy, very good.

Pours cloudy golden color with white head. Aroma is a citrus orange explosion with mango, orange zest, and dank pine. Flavor is big, fresh juicy orange with mango, citrus zest and finishing with juicy grapefruit and bitter grapefruit rind. Really fresh and juicy beer.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Hazy orange color, looks like orange juice. Smells like juicy, tropical fruit with a dank hint. Taste follows with some sweet juicy fruits like orange and papaya. Body feels very smooth but not heavy. Very balanced IPA, doesnt seem bitter at all for me, just a lot of hops in the taste and aroma but with a moderate amount of bitterness, just to balance the beer.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2015 Can, from Jay or Mike,drunk Heady Topper style at Mikes flat. I cant really judge the appearance but everything else I can.

Dank as hell. Juicy as hell. Some raw onions. Bitterness is absolutely insane. Easily one of the best IPAs Ive ever had and this is some compliment. Chewy tangy tropical fruits and starburst sweet-like qualities. I can drink plenty of this. Super clean. Super good. Banging. A note i had this a day old or something silly fresh. This beer drops off soo fast if you dont have it fresh. It doesnt travel either. Drink fresh!

Had 10 of these, and its starting to grow on me, while its not the most potent and in your face IPA, its really really good and very drinkable. Aroma of orange juice, straight up, with nice floral resiny background. The big plus with this one is the mouthfeel, very soft and velvety, almost nitro-like, quite thick but airy, the beer in general just feels very smooth and soft, but packed with big tropical fruit flavours.

August 16, 2015. Can at home, received in a trade, thanks! 
Cloudy orange with a large, slowly dissipating , white head. Aroma is very fruity and juicy with orange juice, mango, orange zest, grapefruit, guava and some light green grassy hop notes. Taste is sweet juicy and soft bitter with a very smooth juicy bitter finish with orange and grapefruit. Medium bodied, extremely creamy texture for an IPA, soft carbonation. Very nice fruity, creamy and drinkable IPA.

Pour is dark orange, extremely cloudy, with lots of white head, some large bubbles, decent retention, and a thick lace. Nose is heavy mango and citrus, with a bit of mango rind, lightly earthy, with notes of grapefruit. Flavor profile follows the nose to a T. Tons of tropical fruit, mango and grapefruit, with a citrus blast, low bitterness, a mostly creamy feel, a touch granule towards the back end with aggressive carbonation. Bitterness creeps up a little through the finish and lingers a touch.

Can to glass. Pours a light amber orange color with an off white head. Aroma is incredible! Huge citrus, fleshy fruit hop character. Tastes like an orange juice IPA. Goes down super easy. Thanks BJ for sharing!

Pours a dark amber, completely hazed color, with a decent, bubbly head.

Smells utmost juicy, of lime infused orange lemonade and an intriguing amount of grass. The aromas are very focused on the beers juiciness, which makes it perfect for a warmer day, revealing peach pulp among a pleasant dankness.

Has a soft mouthfeel till the end, in which a lively, very bubbly carbonation creates an outstanding refreshment, coating up a distinct hoppiness. 

Tastes of a soft fruitiness, entangled in dough whitebread malts, inviting the palate to a fantastic, soft mouthfeel. Its initial softness turns into a pleasant dank flavor, revealing wet grass, amped up by unripe orange peel and tangerine pulp. The malts then develop a natural sweetness, resulting from ripe orange, balanced by crisp lemon peel. Finishes with an outstandingly pleasant, exotic, fruitiness, sparkly carbonation and fitting, well pronounced maltiness which doesnt turn too sweet at no point.

Stunning, extreme rich, exuberant taste profile, leaving no desire unfullfilled as for what to expect from an ipa. Features a generous fruitiness, which offers up a great depth of hoppy flavors, perfectly illustrated by profound malts, which supports the gentle bitterness outstandingly well.

16oz can to snifter. Hazy orange with a big slightly off white head. So much citrus, mango, pineapple, juiciness. A touch of bitter cattiness on the finish, which my palate is super sensitive to. So smooth on the palate. May I please have this all summer?

Cloudy Amber orange; thin rimming beige head; aroma is mild hoppy spicy slight citrus peel notes; flava is rich hop grain notes of green tea; feels medium nice fizzy zing; finishes tangy slightly bitter and long

Fresh Can. Pours a dark muddy orange color with a modest white head. Opaque; to say it is hazy is an extreme understatement. The aroma is wonderful. Citrus and tropical fruit, orange, mango, passionfruit. Taste is similar with loads of flavor hops up front followed my a moderate bitterness. Medium bodied; average carbonation; finishes lightly bitter.
Can in trade. Pours a cloudy orange. Aroma is fruity, citrus, some dank notes. Taste is light, dry, fruity, then bitterness takes over. Not overpowering, but it does linger. Good beer.

Can shared by Troy. Nose is huge orange and lightly dank. Murky orange pour like OJ. Taste us more or less OJ with a light acidity to it. Bitterness and alcohol linger on second sip. Pretty quenchable.

Can shared at the July MDF tasting. Murky orange, thin creamy off-white head, decent retention. Aroma of strong orange, pith, pale malt, vanilla. The taste is orange, dry citrus, vanilla, pale malt, tropical fruits. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness.

Can. Canned about 9 days ago, but I also had this same batch a week ago (2-3 days old). Nice looking pour, albeit super hazy and cloudybut thats how i know its good. I like the unfiltered look, it makes me feel more confident I will enjoy a certain ipa, but i understand those who want to see a clean appearance. Nose is juicy citrus, quite dry, light mango and guava with a big splash of grapefruit. Flavor is similar..very green at this point still. Hard to tell if it is falling off or still too green. Kinda has that vegetal green flavor thing going on that is difficult to decipher. Definitely better a week ago, but still very good now. Glad I got to try this. Now to make it to the brewery later this summer. Everything is better at the source.

Pours a cloudy golden orange color with a very large white head. The aroma is strongly dominated by oranges with other tropical fruits playing background music. On the palate, it is very sweet up front with a pretty modest bitter note to clean things up on the back. Dangerously drinkable.
Can from trade. So eager to try this. Pours very orange with a big head. Exotic hops, oranges, citrus, truly a fine IPA, maybe the best I've tried.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 Re-rating this based on having it again 11-11 (original rating was below). Can around 2 weeks old this time and what a turn around! I think I held onto the last one way too long before and it must have turned and fallen way off. Pour was orange and cloudy with a fluffy white head with lacing left on the glass. Aroma bursts out with tons of orange, peach, mango, passion fruit notes. Quite wonderful. Flavor follows the nose with tons of juicy fruits and a very lovely bitter bite to it. This reminded me of the Curiosity 22 I had recently, except I liked this a little better. What a difference a fresh can makes from my first impression. Medium body, a sticky texture, bubbly carbonation, and a bitter bite to end. Superb! Original rating started here and Ill leave for reference......................................... #400 for me! Sadly, it was a letdown of a beer I really hyped :(
Aroma was decent with citrus and tropical fruits, but a sweet maltiness was present, which I knew was a bad sign (at least for me, we all have different tastes and preferences). Flavor was very malty, sweet, orange, and had an apple juice taste. Not much as far as hop flavor stood out. This can was from the release before the recent 6-12 one. From my calulation that is only around one month. Im kind of shocked that it would have already fallen off in that short window. Either that, or this was the way it was supposed to be and I just wasnt a fan.

Got a can of this on a trade as an extra. Very simple cool can. Basically a silver tin can with a simple orange logo. Poured into a glass. Very cloudy pale straw body. Smells so good. Lots of citrus in the aroma. Just amazing aroma. Big fruity taste. Tons of citrus and orange come though. Fairly bitter as well. Absolutely excellent beer.
Can, few days old.. Hazy dark yellow pour. Aroma is huge citrus, taste is big citrus bitter and a dry finish, great beer

Can at home, courtesy of Armin. Pour is hazy orange with a big white head and good lacing. Big mango, orange peel, pineapple, lightly grassy, some papaya, and passion fruit in the aroma. Taste is orange peel, zesty, pineapple, grapefruits, lemony, some biscuit, and pine with a big bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Really fruity and bitter - tasty stuff.

Pour out of 16 oz can, hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of big orange, grapefruit, nice tropical fruit, passion fruit, slight biscuit, nice bread. Taste was a mix of bread, orange, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, pine, grass, finishing fairly sweet, slightly bitter.

Can @ Steve_0 during my 10k tick fest. Thanks Armin! Pours a murky, dull orange appearance with an off white head. A little bit dank but the main appearance is tons of mango, orange juice, pineapple, and some passion fruit. Juicy. Pretty full body. Tons of citrus and some dank notes. Clean finish. Good.

16oz can shared by Dan P. Poured a hazy orange color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of fresh oranges, mango, armpits, lots of sweet citrus, and a hint of perfume. Taste of fresh lemon, orange, mango, pale malts, and citrus zest. Super fruity and very crushable. Solid stuff
Growler at Campground Brewdown 2014. Pours a hazed amber with a thin white head. Big spicy citrus, musk on the nose. Medium bodied, nice and musky, more citrus.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2016 A friend picked up a growler from the brewery: this is the first of their beers that I have had. It lived up to the hype: this is an excellent IPA. It pours an orangish color with a nice head on it. Nice nose. Its fairly hoppy, with orange and tropical notes. The taste is also quite good. Lots of tropical and orange hoppy flavors. A faint sweetness from the malt body. Very smooth. A very nice beer.  Edit:  Have had the canned version now too.  It is equally good!

The appearance is a murky orange/brown that still manages a clean white head on the top. Super fruit aroma with lots of orange juice. Theres a champagne-like yeast aroma, but maybe a little too much booze. The fruitiness continues into the flavor, absolutely delicious. Very sweet malts to back up the fruit, along with some bitterness that invites another sip. Excellent soft yet thick mouthfeel. Great stuff out of western Mass.

growler fill. pours a cloudy golden orange with small head. This beer has the best aroma of any beer I have ever had! Strong citrus aroma - mango, citrus, and citrus. A delicious, tropical tasting IPA. My favorite IPA that I have ever had!

Growler... Pours hazy and golden with a mid-sized, foamy, white head. Good retention. The aroma offers plenty of peaches and apricots, a modest measure of armpit-like funk and touches of cat piss and tropical fruit. Medium to full-bodied with airy carbonation. The flavor showcases heavy, earthy bitterness accompanied by biscuit and honey malts. Trends a tad toward the bitter side of balance, but well-balanced overall. Finishes bittersweet and resiny. Growler courtesy of biggsbowler!

Growler, filled 12/19 and opened today. Pours beautiful cloudy orange with small head. Aroma is intensely juicy tropical nectar with tons of peach, citrus zest, and fragrant honey too. Taste is at once juicy and crisp with lots of mango and lychee, and an amazing light body that managed to also be full. The texture is one of the most impressive aspects, not at all heavy or doughy or bloated. Out of control.

[6651-20140816] Growler. Light citrus zest and toasted grains aroma. Slightly hazy, pale orange yellow body with a quick foamy white head. Lightly bittered citrus woody flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/7/3/15) 3.5
(@ Campground Brewdown 2014, Millmont, PA)

Growler. Pours orange-brown with a thick white colored head. Citrus pine aroma over mild carbonation. Tasty ipa with some complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap, orange pour, white head, nose is grapefruit, taste is oranges, lemons, bitter, hoppy, awesome

P: Hazy orange with a one finger head. S: Damn! Just strong tropical hops, mangos and pineapples, oranges and just completely floral. T: Mangos and pineapples, light malt sweetness. in the end. M: Medium body and medium carbonation. O: That smell was freaking amazing.
Thanks a bunch to biggsbowler for the share. Tropical and citrus fruit but not as pungent as I expected from a beer with this much hype. Fairly pithy bitterness in the finish.
Growler shared by biggsbowler. Clear light yellow pour with a white head. Grapefruit hop aromas. Big grapefruit hop notes dominate. Sturdy malt backbone. Very good mouthfeel with a good body.
Growler thanks Luke - Pours cloudy yellow. Oranges, tangerines, and grapefruit in the nose. Grapefruit, lemon zest, and piney in the taste. Tasty!

Lightly hazed golden pour with resilient head retention. Glowing, gentle hop aroma. Muskmelon, passionfruit, candied orange rind and flower petals. Sauvignon Blanc grapes and their gravelly, limestone and flint powder affect. 

The flavor has more greenness to it, blending grasses and dandelion into the juicy citrus acids of the new world hops. It has all the hallmarks of the nouveaux version of the style, with super bright fruits, distant though ample malts, and brittle, drying yeast texture. Still, in the minutiae of details there is a bothersome slick sugar component to this, reminiscent of caramel or crystal malt. 

This is enough to quietly taint the generally austerely clean texture here, leaving the thinnest film of bittersweet tea-colored sugar to coat the mouth; the important distinction here is that this is the only limitation of this otherwise brilliant example.
Growler shared by a friend. Clear amber in color with a thick off-white head. Aroma of malt, grapefruit and tropical fruit. Malty and citrusy flavor with some pine before a spicy finish.

750ml growler pours cloudy dark orange with medium head. Nose is sticky dank herbal orange and peach, piney tropical citrus fruit. Taste is a peach juice bomb, sticky grassy, herbal, citrus, resin, light malt and medium bitterness. Finish is more lasting tropical fruit, peach, pear, delish!

750ml bottle thanks to Rich. Pours out a hazy straw topped with a white head. Nose is great pine citrus hops tropical fruit and caramel sweetness. Taste is as the nose with a very nice and well balance hop malt combo. This was very good.

Growler, courtesy of a kind soul... shared in a location remote of my dining room. 
Pours a lightly hazy yellow color with a small head and some lacing on the glass.

The aroma very hop forward, dank, with some melon & citrus rind... bright fruitiness, and all around wonderfulness. Totally inviting. 

The flavor is a touch spicy with citrus and melon. Its defiantly got a lot of orange character to it as well as some tropical fruit. The beer is fairly dry with a nice medium level of bitterness. 

Pretty great.
Growler. Pours orange with a white head. Fruity citric hops, some tropical fruity notes, lighter piney notes, and a clean pale malty base. Just downright chuggable. Dope.

Big thanks to Deuane for cracking this growler open at Campground Brewdown.


A - Pours hazy peach orange with a beautiful one and a half finger tall white head, quickly dissipating down to a thin white film, leaving sticky webs of lace on the sides of the glass.


S - Smells of freshly zested tropical fruit, a whole field worth of fresh cut grass, sticky pine resin and some mild caramel sweetness. The hops are so strong but not totally over the top. 


T - Starts off much more balanced than the nose. The piney, grassy, tropical fruit hop punch is there in spades but the slightly sweet caramel malt is there to hold it in check for the most part. The finish is nearly identical but the bitterness does eventually win out, leaving the palate quite dry.


M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Smooth, hoppy feel with plenty of dryness backing it up. The hops meld amazingly well with the base grain.


O - One of the better IPAs I have had in recent memory. The hops are intense and yet they dont destroy the palate. Now that I have friends in the area I am really looking forward to visiting them in the near future to try all these beers on-tap.

Poured a hazy orange color with a medium sized, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, light tropical fruits, some pine, grass, and a bit of toast. Taste of citrus, light pine, orange, tropical fruits, and lightly bitter, hop finish.

Pours hazy unclear thick syrupy orange with a beige head. Aroma brings zesty and sweet orange like hops soft and pleasant in the nose. This beautiful brew sits in the mouth like mango and every orange tropical fruit juice you have ever tasted! Absolute IPA magic in the mouth on the full body, so juicy and ending with a nice citrus dryness.

2014-08-16. Hazy bright orange body with a small white head. 3+ Aroma of light musky hops, lemon, sweetish malt core. 6++ Flavour is mildly bitter throughout, lemon and citrus melange is muddled but enjoyable. Smooth average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Decent but I didnt love it as much as others seemed to. Growler at Campground Brewdown

Growler at Campground Brewdown. Cloudy apple juice body with white head. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some spicy, orange, pineapple. Taste is moderately sweet, orange, some grapefruit, light pineapple. Medium body, light effervescence.
Another damn tasty Vermont IPA from Matt. This is full of orange. Like an IPA mimosa.

Thanks, jlindros. The beer is bright orangey gold in color. Its quite hazy, which I rather like for an IPA.. Not that I really dislike clear IPAs. Eh. The head is white and fairly vigorous for a growler pour. Lots of lacing. Good retention. Even after a few minutes and many sips, theres still a solid coating of bubbles on top. The aroma is massively juicy and full of hop flavor. Citrus for days. I remember reading BuckeyeNation use the term "electric tangerine" in a review; that would be a very apt descriptor for this beer. It smells like tangerine juice with a healthy shot of lime. Theres also pineapple, kiwi, raspberry, grapefruit and pine. Its like a wonderful citrus drink spiked with a tropical fruit background. Mouthwatering stuff. Little malt presence, which is just fine with me. Taste is similarly big on juicy hop flavors. Pale malt sweetness is well in the background. Tangerine, grapefruit and lime hoppiness dominates with tropical fruits providing highlights. Moderate bitterness. Fairly dry. Tangerine rind finish. Extremely easy to drink. Light, pleasant feel. Seems like normal carbonation. Some hop oiliness. Each sip makes me want more. I feel a bit bad not sharing this growler, but Im also glad that I didnt. This is a fantastic IPA, fully deserving its acclaim. Tree House continues to impress.

Pours a clear orange/gold with a medium white head. Aroma has lots of orangey rindy notes. Flavor follows suit...lots of orange but more rindy than juicy. Mouthfeel is light/medium and the finish is dry and rindy and slightly resinous.

In trade, thanks! Pours hazy rich orange. Smell is orange, mango and fruity. Taste is fruity, hoppy but very, very light bitterness I thought. Very fresh, light and refreshing bitterness and tons of hop flavor. Fantastically drinkable and light feeling. Just the kind of IPA I like with lots of hop flavor, low bitterness and a full but not syrupy feel or heaviness. Clean, and refreshing.

Growler shared with the fellas at HamTech Reunion 2014 - Clinton, NY. Pours hazy gold with a white foam top. Rich fruits abound with lots of the tropical stuff, melon, tangerine and orange. Not too bitter, fairly sweet. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Juicy and rich but still well rounded. Really juicy on the finish with some honey, pale bread, lots more melon and tasty citrus. Just loads of expressive fruit character in here. Wonderful.
Citrusy aroma with a smooth feel on the palate. Sweet and fruity tastes, a good summer beer.

Poured from growler into a tulip: Pours hazy golden with a pillowy white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, mango, and citrus. Taste is very tropical, a little sweet, with a bitter finish. Medium body, a little stick, and overall a great IPA but certainly not Tree Houses best (yet it seems to be the most popular).
UPDATED: MAY 20, 2015 Can. Pours yellow gold with white head. Nose/taste of pineapple, orange peel, caramel malt, biscuit and sugared pine. Medium body. Dry finish.
Sample at Culmination Fest: Poured a coppery color with a white head. Aroma is hug citrus blast. Taste is a nice blend of citrus fruits and hops.

Growler: Thanks, Alex. Half-hazy, brown-ish tinted amber body wit ha mildly beige, foamy head that takes its time settling into a chunky collar. Lovely aroma of juicy orange, fresh leaves, & slightly pungent citrus peels... Grapefruit-y with a mild, soft perfume essence, backed by hints of resin, wet hemp oil, cut grass, & an awesome, back-end citrus bite. The taste reveals a tiny bit of passion fruit before it busts open with juicy orange flesh, gushing citrus rind, & slight undertones of pine needles. Slightly resinous & oily, edging on dank but never fully getting there... So damn smooth, juicy & finishing with a crisp balance of citrus & tropical hoppage. Oily mouth feel with a dry finish; this is a killer IPA, one I could drink day in & day out. Thanks again to Alex for this one.
Beautiful pour: sticky, stubborn head & lace. Fresh, piney, dry hops. Orange zest, juicy tropical fruits, damn tasty. I could drink way too much of this.

Bouteille de 750 ml achetée directement à la brasserie au coût de 12.00$. Arôme: Odeur de pamplemousse avec une pointe de mangue. Apparence: La couleur est cuivrée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle le verre. Saveur: Goût de pamplemousse avec une pointe de fruits tropicaux. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #5529)

3 day old growler, thanks Shayne! Pours bright orange with a fluffy two finger white head. Generous lacing. Aromas of peaches, oranges, lemon peel, mango and a lingering pine. Taste follows the nose. Very nice balance of flavors with a medium-to-full mouthfeel for the style. A minimal bitterness to the finish that is loaded with more tropical fruits. This is like drinking juice! Very impressed by this IPA.

Growler..Pour is golden with a thin white head...Pour is light gomd with a thin head..Nose is peach skin, soft hop, spice, lemon zest...Taste gummy bears, Peach, Limon zest, Pine hop, very easy drinking

Growler. Thanks Ernesto. Pours a hazy then clear orange with slight white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, mango and citrus. Taste is mango to the extreme. Great taste and just the right amount of bitterness. Lemon comes in at the end. Great IPA.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Taster from a growler at RBNEG. Supplied by either Reynolds314 or Ernesto987, not sure, kudos however. Poured into a wine glass. Pours a sexy glowing orange with a one finger white head. Some lace. Tropical fruit & citrus aroma assaults the olfactory senses, stunning you temporarily. A second whiff and you pick up some minor background malt. Slightly bitter on the tongue, but still plenty of fruit on the taste. Full bodied and it leaves you wanting more. Very nice.

Fresh growler shared by Reynolds314. Bright yellow color, large lasting head. Aroma is ton of bright fruit and grassy hops. 
Flavor is juicy with fruity and grassy like the aroma. Mangos, peaches, stone fruit with lots of pale malt with some sweet bready backbone. Some grassy hops with hints of bitter grapefruit however, the juicy fruits take this over. Low bitterness when its all said and done. Borderline drinking a fruit cup. Still very nice stuff.

Reynolds314 supplied the growler. To oversized snifter, it pours a dark syrupy orange with a with a sudsy off-white head 1 finger in length. Smells and tastes of west coast hops, salad greens, and tart apples. Utterly enjoyable.
growler, wow, 6.5%???? seemed way bigger. big citrus, mango notes. beautiful flavor & bitterness. big mouthfeel, big flavor. seek out
UPDATED: APR 4, 2016 Pours cloudy amber small off white head. Great hoppy fruity citric piny nose and similar flavor loaded with tropical fruits sweet and pungent.

My Bottom Line:
Grapefruit zest and grassy hop resins whirl within this IPAs honey coulis, building a tasty example of the style.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam sits atop the misty blond.
-Mouthfeel is slick and perhaps too softly carbonated. 
-This one didnt feel as vibrant as the superb Tornado growler we had picked up on the same day. Not sure if its a recipe or freshness issue.
-Cant wait to get a pint of this on tap at their bigger and badder brewery!

Growler.

750ml fliptop courtesy of ClarkVV. Thanks, dude. Opened at a deyholla tick-a-thon. Pours a deeper dark amber orange hue, copper glow with decent haze. Frothy offwhite head sits atop and stays as a goof frothy layer, sticks around and laces well. Nice. Aromas are bigger citrus rind, lots of orange, some grapefruit juice, some lemon, and florals. Some sweetness, fruit, big orange and grapefruit hybrid life is juicy and lovely. A touch sweet. Initial lighter end of medium bodied, big juicy orange juice, grapefruit, citrus and pithy elements. Some gentle bread, florals and cleaner dry bitter qualities. Middle still sustains that juicy citrus element, lots of orange and grapefruit, tangerine and some lemon. Wow. Juicy, intense, dryness and citric elements creep and hit the backend well. Some juiciness, nicely dry with touches of gumball, melon, faint tropical fruit back here. Some soap, melon, really good flavors. A touch of body, Id say its a touch sweet, but that sweetness is truly derived from a rich citrus flavor element. Lots of flavor, rich, really citrus driven. Very impressive flavor intensity. Nice stuff.

Bottle thanks to Adam! Pours a near clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a pine and grapefruit combination with a hint of citrus. Flavor has a more citrus with a bit of pine and grapefruit backing.

Growler shared by Jomonobo ! Pours a hazy golden orange color with a finger of foam. The nose has some tropical punch with notes of mango, pineapple, grass and hints of pine. The palate follows with a juicy round mouthfeel and lots of lingering fruit to mingle with the medium bitter finish. Would gladly crush a few glasses in a sitting !

Growler thanks to ClarkVV. Pours hazy orange amger with a small white head, creamy with nice lacing. Aroma is strong as soon as the growler is popped, citrus, pine, passionfruit, grapefruit, dank goodness. Flavor is the same, light sweet, light bitter, juicy dank and rich. Medium plus body, oily mouthfeel. Tiny bit harsh on the far finish, but all in all definitely one of the good ones.

Growler @ Beachwood Brewing, thanks to Clark for this treat. Hazy orange with a nice white head. Wow, incredible fruit character on the nose. Tons of pineapple, papaya, mango, and grapefruit. Tangerine, some caramel sweetness, and blueberry. This smells amazing. Flavor isnt as intense, but still quite good. Tastes like a blueberry muffin. Pine and herbal/weed bitterness. Moderate pineapple and mango with some grapefruit. Solid.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2014 tap offering @ brewery. kegged @ 2 days ago. pleasant aromatic juicy pineapple, clementine, passionfruit medley with a hint of juicy grapefruit bitterness. pretty nice. lotta big fruity passionfruit offered in the taste. carbonation on the low end. clean. fruity IPA.  very low bitterness.  beer does do some lifting.

Bottle. Cloudy gold/orange body with a frothy white head. Aroma of resin, grapefruit, citrus, mango, passion fruit, toasted grain. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Resiny flavor, but not overwhelming because of the light caramel, tangerine and other citrus fruits plus peach and mango. Better than so many one-dimensional, resinous IPAs.

A: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Oranges, Tangarines, Mildly Bready

T: Grapefruit, Oranges, Mildly Zesty

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Bitter

Overall, this must be a single hopped beer but it is pretty damn good and very drinkable.

750mL flip-top growler at Woodshop 8. Pours a low haze, bright golden. Low foam. Nose is sticky fresh mango pulp, juicy. Taste is a bit cheesy, biscuit, nutty, aggressive citrus peel. Juicy, soft palate. Very nice.
Orange pour, soapy white head. Dank aroma and some sweet citrusy goodness. Flavor is citrusy, juicy and somewhat bitter. But within the hops is some really nice sweet malts. Wonderful.
Poured from a swing-top bottle to find one of the most exquisite, balanced and tasty IPAs Ive ever had. This is truly a world-class beer and one of Massachusetts finest.

750 ml growler served in a Kuhnhenn snifter. Thanks to time4lunch for the brew.

A: Pours a hazy orange color with a one finger height of white foam forming on the pour. It recedes to a thin film that leaves sticky sheets of lace down the glass.

S: So juicy and vibrant. Fruity mango, pineapple and orange. Floral notes with a sweet bread malt body. Grassy with a mild citrus pith.

T: Really follows the nose. The mango is a little more juicy with accenting pineapple, pear and orange citrus. Sweet floral notes with a little bitterness from the light grassy notes. Minimal malt sweetness on the backend.

M: This is wonderful. Super light with just a little prickle from the carbonation. Sweet, fruity and floral on the finish. The drinkability is out of this world.

O: Absolutely crushable. I could drink growler upon grolwer of this stuff. Perfectly balanced with nod given to the hops to come to the forefront.

Serving type: growler

09-13-2013

750 ml swing top growler surprise from WillRunForBeer! Pours a cloudy orange color with a medium sized foamy head that quickly fades to ring and leaves some lacing. Could smell the aroma instantly on the pour. Juicy, dank hops. Passionfruit, pineapple, grapefruit, oranges, banana, lemons, light grass, light caramel, and peaches. Taste is different than I expected based on the aroma. Its thick and hoppy but not really that juicy, which is a good thing here. I expected overpowering sweetness based on the aroma but its pretty mellow here and its balanced out by the moderate bitterness. Still lots of passionfruit and citrus in the taste but Im also getting berries, pine, and flowers now. Medium to thick body with a soft, smooth mouthfeel. Slightly dry in the finish. Great complex IPA. Right up there with some of my favorites.

Entered a few days late to avoid spoiling a surprise. Pours brown gold with an offwhite head that lingers and coats the glass. Aromas of orange, mango and pine. Taste pale malt backbone which is mostly overpowered by sweet tangerine citrus and pine hops. Very nice.

2 liter growler from the brewery. Poured into a Tree House tulip glass. The appearance is a very turbid golden orange with a white two finger head. The lacing sticked to the glass and also had great head retention.  The aromas of this beer were spectacular.  Dank tropical and citrus fruits. Some subtle hints of melon and pine. This flavors did not disappoint.  Started slightly malty  and then the bitterness takes over until it dries out. This beer is dangerously drinkable.  My first Tree House beer with many more to come.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2015 Growler shared with Max and Brian, courtesy of Brian - huge thanks for this tasty treat. Pours a deep, hazy amber orange body with nice fluffy white lacing that lasts throughout the session. Aroma is fresh cut grass, juicy melon, fresh & funky dank Nelson, lemons and funky pine. Mouthfeel is fuller, fluffy and super sessionable. This reminds me of a fuller, richer version of the Eureka.  Incredible cascading notes of dank herb, grass, melons, mangos, lemons and fruit juice. I no longer rate, but this time I am making an exception at the request of a friend who sent me the growler, simply saying that "Julius is the Truth"

I have had a lot of IPAs before and must say that this one goes down as one of the most enjoyable that I have had in quite some time. The smell is killer, loads of tropical fruit with peach and mango at the forefront, followed by a very subtle light caramel sweetness. It was a cloudy gold and poured a puffy white head with good retention. The taste was incredibly fruity and drinkable. Dominantly citrusy will a very mild bitterness and sweetness from the malt. Maybe its a personal preference but I love drinking tropical fruit salads like this. The body was equally as impressive as it was soft and full.

I can honestly say that after having this beer Julius is the Truth. I did not go in with any expectations, but left wanting more and wishing that the glass would never end.

Pour from a 64 oz counter pressure filled growler into a Treehouse tulip glass. The beer was kegged this morning so an IPA doesnt get much fresher than this. 

A - Unfiltered IPA porn. This beer pours a gorgeous hazy peach/orange body. Super hazy and holding it up to the light just illuminates that perfect color. Three fingers of an off-white head with sticky lacing and long lasting retention. Thick edging sticks around the whole time. I cant imagine a beer looking any better than this.

S - I had a few pours of this earlier and saved half of it to properly review later. When I reopened the growler I got a release of carbonation and with it a blast of rich and sweet tropical notes. In the glass I get layers of bitter grapefruit, sweet yet under ripe peaches, mango, and a faint touch of biscuits.

T - A rather unique hop profile that really makes itself stand out from other IPAs. Bitter grapefruit lead into super sweet concentrated peach juice. Its almost tropical, but the level of sweetness really points toward a peach or apricot for me. Finishes with a touch of clean crackers and a quick hit of bitterness. It starts off being very concentrated, juicy, and sweet but it quickly transitions into a very clean and refreshing finish.

M - Medium bodied with a nice level of carbonation. The level of bitterness is just perfect here, quick and intense but fades away pleasantly. Crazy drinkable.

O - For a beer that is being brewed out of a shed in a guys front yard in Central Massachusetts...this is just fucking phenomenal stuff. Totally impressed and left wishing I had purchased many, many more growlers of this. The next Hill Farmstead? Probably not. But I am very lucky to have this place so close to me.
